earmark.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to decide that something will be used for a particular purpose or have something done to it in the future
earmark.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: 85% of foreign aid is earmarked by Congress for specific purposes.
He had been earmarked as a potential leader.
earmark.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to plan to use something for a particular purpose or to give someone a particular role
earmark.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Of the money provided, 80% was earmarked for use in metropolitan areas.
He had been earmarked as a possible successor to Bush.
